STR.REQ: The _MapComponent_ shall support different types of map layers (e.g.  terrain  satellite)
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _MissionPlanner_ shall execute flight plans for multiple UAVs concurrently.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ shall transmit the UAV's properties to the _GCSMiddleware_
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ shall transmit the UAV's current location to the _GCSMiddleware_
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ shall report newly connected UAVs to the _GCSMiddleware_.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ shall assign a message frequency for all UAVs.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When the _GCS_ receives a UAV command from the _GCSMiddleware_  the _GCS_ shall forward the command to the respective UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When the connection to the _GCS_ from the _GCSMiddleware_ is lost  the _GCSMiddleware_ shall notify Dronology and deactivate all associated UAVs.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _GCSMiddleware_ shall forward commands sent from Dronology to a _GCS_
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _GCSMiddleware_ shall handle state messages   monitoring messages  and mode change messages  received from an _GCS_.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _GCSMiddleware _ shall follow a predefined set of steps to establish a connection between a _GCS_ and Dronology
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _GCSMiddleware_ shall handle multiple _GCS_
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _DronologyRuntimeMonitor_ shall be able to receive messages from any Dronology component
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a new monitoring message is received the _DronologyRuntimeMonitor_ shall forward the message to all subscribed clients
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _DronologyRuntimeMonitor_ shall provide functionality to retrieve monitoring messages and distribute them to clients
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RealTimeFlightUI_ shall notify users when an emergency occurs.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RealTimeFlightUI_ shall allow users to follow one or multiple UAVs on the map.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RealTimeFlightUI_ shall allow users to perform emergency operations (e.g. hovering multiple UAVs  sending multiple UAVs to home) to a group of UAVs
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RealTimeFlightUI_ shall allow users to apply flight operations to one or more selected UAVs.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RealTimeFlightUI_ shall display all currently active flight plans on the map.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RealTimeFlightUI_ shall display the name and status of all currently activated UAVs
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When the _RouteCreationUI_ is loaded a list of all existing routes shall be displayed.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RouteCreationUI_ shall allow a user to delete a route.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RouteCreationUI_ shall allow the user to create and modify a route.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When requested  the _RouteCreationUI_ shall send a newly created or modified route to dronology.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: Each route shall include a unique ID  a textual description  and a set of waypoints  all of which are editable in the UI.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RouteCreationUI_ shall only accept valid altitude and speed values for waypoint.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RouteCreationUI_ shall distinguish between starting  ending  and intermediate waypoint markers.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a user shall cancels a pending flight plan the _RouteAssignmentUI_ shall notify Dronology.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: A user may reorder routes or remove flight plans assigned to a UAV as long as the flight has not started execution.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a UAV is selected  the _RouteAssignmentUI_ shall display its active flight plans.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When requested by the user  the _RouteAssignmentUI_ shall display details about the selected UAV and its flight plans.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a route is assigned or removed from a UAV  the _RouteAssignmentUI_ shall notify Dronology.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RouteAssignmentUI_ shall provide means to select an existing routes and assign them to a UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When loading the map view it shall be positioned at the pre-defined location
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When the _VaadinUI_ is activated  the _VaadinUI_ shall be configured according to stored configuration parameters.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall accept and activate a mission plan upon request.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall enable an existing route to be assigned to an active UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall enable the creation and modification of flight routes
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ accepts commands from UIs and forwards to Dronology
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall provide a list of all existing routes
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall provide a list of all active UAVs
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _ActivityLogger_ shall log all commands sent to and messages received from a _CGS_.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _ActivityLogger_ shall log all flight plan related events.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _InternalSimulator_ shall approximate the state of the battery
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When given a landing command the _InternalSimulator_ shall move the UAV from to the ground altitude corresponding to its current longitude and latitude.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When given a goto command  the _InternalSimulator_ shall update the location of the UAV at increments of {{SIMULATION_STEP_SIZE}} meters  moving it towards the target destination until the destination is reached.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When given a takeoff command the _InternalSimulator_ shall move the UAV to the takeoff altitude corresponding to its current longitude and latitude.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _InternalSimulator_ shall approximate the behavior of a UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UAVRegistrationManager_ shall store UAV meta-data information  such as the UAV's technical characteristics
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When the maximum numbers of allowed activated UAVs has been reached  the _UAVActivationManager_ shall reject any further activation requests.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a UAV is deactivated the _UAVActivationManager_ shall cancel all current and scheduled flight plans
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _VehicleCore_ shall support virtual UAVs
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _VehicleCore_ shall support UAVs connected via the _GCS_
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a group of UAVs are assigned flight patterns as part of a mission  the system shall provide a warning if any paths overlap.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: A flight pattern shall document the longitude  latitude  and altitude of waypoints in a flight route as offsets from the starting position of the UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: If requested  the _SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler_ shall abort the currently executing flight plan of an UAV
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: If a UAV does not have any pending flight plans  then when it reaches the final waypoint of its current flight plan  the _SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler_ shall notify the UAV to hover in place.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: If a scheduled flight is not manually assigned to a UAV  the _SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler_ shall assign the route automatically to an UAV
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: If a route contains a specific {{UAV_ID}}  the _SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler_ shall assign the route to the given UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When requested  the _SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler_ shall schedule a route for execution.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When requested  if a mission is currently active  the _MissionPlanner _shall cancel the active mission.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _MissionPlanner _shall manage predefined FlightPatterns
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a flight plan is activated for a UAV currently on the ground  the _FlightSchedulingandExecution _shall notify the UAV to takeoff vertically until it reaches the prescribed altitude.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: "If a flight plan is active and the ""hover in place"" command is rescinded  the _FlightManager_ shall notify the UAV to continue to the originally designated waypoint."
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: If a flight route is assigned to a UAV which is currently hovering in place  the _FlightManager_ shall assign the route and maintain the hover in place mode.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: "When the ""hover in place"" command is issued  the _FlightManager_ shall halt the UAV in place and maintain its current position."
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When given two coordinates the _CoordinateSystem_ shall compute the direction from the first coordinate to the second coordinate.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When given two coordinates the _CoordinateSystem_ shall compute the distance between them.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When requested  the _CoordinateSystem_ shall transform coordinates to alternate formats.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a flight route requires a customized takeoff altitude that differs from the system's default takeoff altitude  it shall be specified in the flight route.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _FlightRouteManager_ shall persist flight routes.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _FlightRouteManager_ shall ensure that all flight routes represent a {{VALID_FLIGHT_ROUTE}}.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _FlightRouteManager_ shall define flight routes as an ordered sequence of waypoints in which the first waypoint represents the first target location and the final waypoint represents the final target location.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: "When the ""return to home"" command is issued  the _FlightManager_ shall return the UAV to its original launch location without issuing any additional waypoint or routing commands."
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When the _GCS_ loses the connection to an UAV  the _GCS_ shall attempt to reconnect
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UAVActivationManager_ shall only activate UAVs that are registered.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a _GCS_ requests activation of a newly detected UAV  the _GCSMiddleware_ shall forward the request to Dronology.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a UAV has an active onboard Obstacle Avoidance  then the _ObstacleAvoidance_ system shall not issue directives
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _ObjectAvoidance_ system only issues commands within the capabilities of the UAV
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: If a UAV takes evasive actions the system will ensure that it will eventually reach its destination
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a stationary or moving object is within the proximity of a UAV the _ObjectAvoidance_ system shall issue evasive directives to the UAV
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _RealTimeFlightUI_ shall display the location of active UAVs as icons on the map.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When the _RealTimeFlightUI_ is loaded  a map shall be displayed.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: If a command is issued by the _VaadinUI_ for an UAV  the _VaadinUI_ shall request control of that UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall only assign one control-client at a time for each UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall provide an interface for registering UI clients.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a UAV's current flight is cancelled  the _SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler_ shall in turn cancel all scheduled flight plans for that UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: If a UAV has pending flight plans  then when it reaches the final waypoint of its current flight plan  the _SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler_ shall execute the next assigned flight plan.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: If requested  the _SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler_ shall unassign the flight plan assigned to a UAV that is awaiting execution.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler_ shall maintain a managed list of pending flight plans for Each UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When a flight plan is executed  the _VehicleCore_ shall send the next waypoint to the UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: Each waypoint shall be specified using coordinates that include longitude  latitude  and altitude.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _VehicleCore_ shall associate a {{UAV_TYPE}} for each UAV defining its basic attributes.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _UAVActivationManager_ shall ensure that only one instance of each registered drone is active at any time.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler_ shall only execute one flight plan at a time for each UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: The _VehicleCore_ shall assign a unique ID to each activated UAV.
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: If a client registers for notifications  the _UIMiddleware_ shall send notifications for specific events
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: When requested  the _VehicleCore_ shall shall transition the UAV between states according to allowed state transitions as depicted in the UAV state transition diagram
label: Requirement

STR.REQ: Each movement command shall specify one of the following command types: {{SET_MONITORING_FREQUENCY  SET_STATE_FREQUENCY}}
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _RouteCreationUI_ shall provide capabilities to modify existing routes.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: "Provides map functionality for displaying routes and UAVs  leveraging off-the-shelf map providers (such as OSM and google maps).   "
label: Feature

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ accepts resend waypoint commands associated with a unique {{UAV_ID}} and forwards to Dronology
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: UAV State messages shall be formatted as JSON objects and contain the {{UAV_ID}} and the {{MODE}}
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If a user attempts to create a route without providing a name then the system shall not save the route.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The display of active flight plans shall include time in flight  traveled distance  remaining distance  completed and total waypoints.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The active flight plan shall be displayed at the top of the list of pending flight plans.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The properties that the _GCS_ sends to the _GCSMiddleware_ shall be defined in JSON
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ shall send the UAV's current properties to the _GCSMiddleware_ when they are received from the UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ requests the UAV's properties every {{UAV_MESSAGE_MONITORING_FREQUENCY}} seconds.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ shall send the UAV's current coordinates to the _GCSMiddleware_ when they are received from the UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ requests the UAV's current coordinates every {{UAV_MESSAGE_STATE_FREQUENCY}} seconds.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: After {{UAV_RECONNECT_TIMEOUT}} has been reached  if connection to the UAV can not be reestablished  the _GCS_ shall send a UAV Timeout message containing the {{UAV_ID}} to the _GCSMiddleware_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If the connection to an UAV is lost and the _GCS_ fails to reconnect  the _GCS_ shall notify the _GCSMiddleware_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If the _GCS_ receives notification that the UAV is incorrectly registered then the _GCS_ closes the connection with the UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ shall send the home location  a time stamp  and the {{UAV_ID}} to the _GCSMiddleware_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the _GCS_ receives a set frequency command from the _GCSMiddleware_ it shall adjust its messange frequency accordingly.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Message frequency shall be defined in units of seconds.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The default message frequency for UAV state messages shall be {{UAV_MESSAGE_STATE_FREQUENCY}}
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The default message frequency for UAV monitoring messages shall be {{UAV_MESSAGE_MON_FREQUENCY}}
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ shall transform commands into a vehicle specific format.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a socket error or time-out occurs  all UAVs associated with the _GCS_ shall be deactivated.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The {{TAKEOFF}} command shall specify the target altitude
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The {{SET_VELOCITY}} shall specify a velocity vector specified using NED (North  East  Down) directions.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The {{SET_GROUNDSPEED}} command shall specify ground speed in meters per second.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The {{GOTO_WAYPOINT}} command shall include a target latitude  longitude  and altitude coordinate
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Each movement command shall specify one of the following command types: {{GOTO_WAYPOINT  SET_GROUNDSPEED  SET_VELOCITY  TAKEOFF  LAND  HOVER}}
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Each command shall include a unique {{UAV_ID}}
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCSMiddleware_ shall be able to handle and send a setStateFrequency command to the respective _GCS_ containing the desired Frequency in ms.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCSMiddleware_ shall be able to handle and send a setMonitoringFrequency command to the respective _GCS_ containing the desired Frequency in ms.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: UAV State messages shall be formatted as JSON objects and contain both mandatory and optional elements.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: UAV Monitoring messages shall be formatted as JSON objects and contain arbitrary information regarding a single UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the activation request is denied  the _GCSMiddleware_ shall send a predefined activation denied message to the _GCS_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the activation request is approved  the _GCSMiddleware_ shall send a predefined activation confirmation message to the _GCS_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCS_ shall be informed of the result of the activation request.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCSMiddleware_ shall call the _UAVActivationManager_ to request UAV activation.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: In step three  the _GCS_ announces its current set of recognized UAVs to the _GCSMiddleware_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: In step two  the _GCSMiddleware_ accepts the connection and sends a handshake message.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Each _GCS_ connecting to the  _GCSMiddleware_ shall be identified through a unique {{GROUNDSTATION_ID}}.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCSMiddleware_ shall only accept one connection for each _GCS_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCSMiddleware_ shall accept connections with multiple _GCS_
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _GCSMiddleware_ shall specify a predefined {{GCS_PORT}} where _GCS_ can connect.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: A monitoring message shall contain a (hierarchical) identifier describing the topic  a message type  a timestamp  and arbitrary serializeable data attached to the message
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _DronologyRuntimeMonitor_ shall provide means to define wildcards i.e.  a client receives messages from all topics associated with the wildcard
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Topics shall be organized in a hierarchical manner meaning that clients can subscribe to all messages  messages from certain GCS  UAVS  and properties
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Clients shall be able to subscribe to any number of topics
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Provides basic data collection capabilities for internal data from Dronology (such as assigned flights) and data provided by the UAV (e.g.  location data and status)
label: Feature

STR.REQ: When the UAV's battery level drops below a predefined threshold  then the UAV health indicator is activated.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: "When ""UI follow mode"" is active  the map should continually zoom and pan so that all selected UAVs are centered and their active routes constitutes 60% of the view."
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: "When ""UI follow mode"" is initiated  the map shall automatically zoom and pan so that all selected UAVs are centered and their active routes constitutes 60% of the view."
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When requested by the user  the UI shall apply the requested emergency action to all selected UAVs; if no UAV is selected  the UI shall apply the emergency action to all UAVs by default.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Operations shall include RTL  takeoff  hover-in-place  and resend command.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The UI shall differentiate between completed  current  and not yet traversed flight segments.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The UI shall periodically request current locations of all registered UAVs from the _UIMiddleware_ and update their locations on the map.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: For each activated UAV  the UI shall display information about that UAV (i.e. longitude  latitude  altitude  groud speed  battery level  etc.)
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Different types of UAVs shall have different icons.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the map is loaded and the all active UAVs list is obtained the _UIRealTimeFlightView_ shall display an icon on the map for each registered UAV based on its current location.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the _RealTimeFlightUI_ is loaded  a map shall be displayed with the default zoom level and center coordinates specified in a configuration file.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The UI shall periodically request the list of all activated UAVs from the _UIMiddleware_ and updates the display of currently activated UAVs
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Upon loading  the UI shall request information about all activated UAVs from the _UIMiddleware_ . Once the _UIMiddleware_ respond to the request  the UI shall display a list of all currently activated UAVs.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the user presses the route delete button  a confirmation message shall be displayed and if confirmed by the user then the route shall be deleted.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When selected by the user  multiple routes shall be displayed simultaneously on the map.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Consecutive waypoints in a route on a map shall be connected by lines.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: "The _RouteCreationUI_ shall support route creation and modification in visual mode allowing the user to click on a location in order to create  modify  or delete a waypoint.  "
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _RouteCreationUI_ shall support route creation and modification in tabular mode by displaying a editable table showing each waypoint and the velocity of the UAV approaching the waypoint.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The route information shall be represented using the Standard Route XML format and transmitted to the _UIMiddleware_
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The UI shall provide respective fields for displaying and modifying the ID  textual description  waypoints  and other route information.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The altitude and speed values shall not exceed the current maximum {{UAV_MAX_ALTITUDE}}. {{UAV_MAX_GROUND_SPEED}} set in the system.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Waypoint colors shall be updated as the flight route is edited (e.g.  when a new first or last waypoint is added.) If current edits are canceled  the colors shall be reset to reflect current waypoints.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: "Provides capabilities for creating new flight routes on a map that are stored in Dronology    "
label: Feature

STR.REQ: When the user presses the cancel pending flight plan button a request is sent to the _UI_Middleware_ to cancel the flight.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Each UAV shall have a cancel pending flight plan button associated with it.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Flight plans assigned to an UAV that have not yet been executed may be deleted by selecting the route and clicking the deselect button.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Flight plans assigned to an UAV that have not yet been executed may be reordered by dragging a route within the list of assigned routes to a new position.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the user requests to view flight plans assigned to a UAV  the UI requests the pending flight plans from the UAV_FlightInfo object and displays them.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When detailed information is requested by the user for a UAV  the UI shall request the UAV_Data object from the _UIMiddleware_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When route assignments are removed from a UAV  a request shall be sent to the _UIMiddleware_ to remove the assignment in Dronology.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: A route shall be assigned to a selected UAV using the mouse to drag and drop or double clicking on the route.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The user shall select a UAV and then assign routes to it from an available route list.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Provides capabilities for selecting existing routes and assigning them to active UAVs
label: Feature

STR.REQ: Before issuing commands to an UAV the _VaadinUI_ shall request control via the _UIMiddleware_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: User interface for managing UAVs  routes  and planning flights.
label: Feature

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall forward a mission plan request to dronology.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall assign the list of waypoints from a route to an active UAV in order to create a flight plan.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When requested by a UI client  the _UIMiddleware_ shall support the modification of an existing flight route with an given ID.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When requested by a UI client  the _UIMiddleware_ shall create a new flight route with a unique ID.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_  accepts return to home commands associated with a unique UAV ID and forwards to Dronology
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ accepts takeoff commands associated with a unique {{UAV_ID}} and forwards to Dronology
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ accepts hover in place commands associated with a unique {{UAV_ID}} and forwards to Dronology
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ retrieves and returns a list of previously saved flight routes
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ returns a list of UAV proxy objects containing information about all active UAVs including location  battery level  ground speed  and health status.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If the heartbeat fails for a client holding one or more control locks after  {{CLIENT_HEARTBEAT_TIME}}   then the _UIMiddleware_ shall release all of its control locks.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall monitor liveness of clients holding control locks on individual UAVs.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The UI middleware shall forward control requests from UI clients to release a control lock on a UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _UIMiddleware_ shall forward control requests from UI clients to hold a control lock on a UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: A client shall register to the _UIMiddleware_ using a unique id
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Provides capabilities for connecting to multiple GCS' sending commands to  and receiving messages from UAVs.
label: Feature

STR.REQ: While the log level {{HW_TRACE}} is active each state and monitoring message shall be logged.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Each connection request  handshake and mode change message shall be logged
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Each command sent to a _GCS_ via the _GCS_Middleware_ shall be logged
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: "The timestamp and the type of action shall be logged into the mission log for each flight plan related event.   This includes (1) time of scheduling  (2) time of execution  (3) time of completing plan  (4) reordering plan  (5) canceling plan"
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a UAV reaches a waypoint while executing a flight plan  a log event shall be created that includes the coordinates of the waypoint  the UAV the flight plan is assigned to  the flight plan ID  and the timestamp.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a flight plan is executed a log event shall be created that includes the name of the route  the UAV it is assigned to  and the execution time stamp.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a flight plan is initiated a log event shall be created that includes the name of the route  the UAV it is assigned to  and the initiation time stamp.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Provides capabilities for logging UAV related events (such as assigned flights  executed missions...).
label: Feature

STR.REQ: When a simulated UAV is in flight  the _NVECSimulator_ shall reduce the battery every second by {{SIMULATOR_BATTERY_DRAIN_VOLTS}}.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When given a land command the _NVECSimulator_ shall immediately change the UAV's current altitude to the ground altitude.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: While responding to a goto command  the _NVECSimulator_ shall continue moving in steps towards the target coordinates until the target has been reached.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When given a goto command the _NVECSimulator_ shall compute the next coordinate based upon the normal vector and altitude of the current position and the normal vector and altitude of the destination. The simulator shall move the UAV with infinite acceleration and use numerical methods to hone in on the next coordinate which will be {{SIMULATION_STEP_SIZE}} meters from the current position along the travel path.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When given a takeoff command the _NVECSimulator_ shall move with infinite acceleration the UAV to the takeoff altitude corresponding to its current longitude and latitude.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a simulated UAV is in flight  the _InternalSimulator_ shall reduce the battery every second by {{SIMULATOR_BATTERY_DRAIN_VOLTS}}.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When given a land command the _InternalSimulator_ shall immediately change the UAV's current altitude to the ground altitude.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: While responding to a goto command  the _InternalSimulator_ shall continue moving in steps towards the target coordinates until the target has been reached.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When given a goto command the _InternalSimulator_ shall compute the next coordinate based upon the angle of travel and the step-size.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When given a takeoff command the _InternalSimulator_ shall move with infinite acceleration the UAV to the takeoff altitude corresponding to its current longitude and latitude.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Provides basic capabilities for simulating the flight of Virtual UAVs.
label: Feature

STR.REQ: Provides capabilities for registering UAVs  i.e.  providing meta-data regarding the UAV (such as payload  wingspan  equipment...)
label: Feature

STR.REQ: The maximum number of activated UAVS shall be defined as {{MAX_UAV}}
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a UAV is deactivated all scheduled flight plans shall be removed from the UAV's flightplan pool.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If the presented {{UAV_ID}} represents a currently registered UAV  then the _UAVActivationManager_ shall activate the UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If the presented {{UAV_ID}} does not represent a currently registered UAV  then the _UAVActivationManager_ will reject the activation and notify the _GCS_Middleware_
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When receiving a new activation request from the _GCS_Middleware_  the _UAVActivationManager_ shall check that the presented {{UAV_ID}} represents a currently registered and non-activated UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If the presented {{UAV_ID}} represents a currently activated UAV  then the _GCS_Middleware_ will be notified and no additional activation will be performed.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Provides capabilities for activating and deactivating both Virtual and Physical UAVs within Dronology.
label: Feature

STR.REQ: When a UAV is in {{LANDING}} state and reaches zero altitude it transitions to {{ON_GROUND}}
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a UAV is in {{IN_AIR}} state and receives a command to land it transitions to {{LANDING}} state
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a UAV is {{IN_AIR}} state and is assigned a flight plan to execute it transitions to {{FLYING}}
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The system shall support internally simulated UAVs
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _VehicleCore_ shall support UAVs capable of receiving and responding to commands sent via the ground control station
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: An internally simulated UAV is instantiated with an ID that is unique from the IDs of all other currently activated UAVs.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: An activation request for a UAV that is received from the _GCS_Middleware_ is only accepted if the UAV provides an ID unique from all other currently activated UAVs.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Each Virtual and Physical drone is associated with a predefined {{UAV_TYPE}} defining its basic attributes.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Core component for managing different types of UAVs.
label: Feature

STR.REQ: If an obstacle is detected within a distance of {{MIN_STOPPING_DISTANCE}} the _ObjectAvoidance_ system shall issue a 'hover in place' command
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The ObjectAvoidance system shall compute pair-wise distances between UAVs
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _ObjectAvoidance_ system shall maintain a list of UAV states
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _ObjectAvoidance_ system shall retrieve the state of the UAVs onboard ObjectAvoidance status.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The _ObjectAvoidance_ system shall retrieve UAV properties and shall check all directives against them.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a UAV which has been receiving evasive directives is no longer in close proximity to an object  the _ObjectAvoidance_ system shall stop sending directives and the UAV will continue towards its destination.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the flight plan is aborted the UAV switches to hover in place mode
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: An aborted flight plan shall not be reassigned to any UAV
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the flight plan is aborted it shall be removed from the associated UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Each UAV can only store one currently executing flight plan ID.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The currently executing flight plan ID is associated with the UAV executing it.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If the flight plan queue is not empty when the UAV reaches the final waypoint of its current flight plan  then the next flight plan is removed from the queue and set as the currently executed flight plan.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a UAV is issued a return-to-home command during a flight then the current flight plan is aborted and all scheduled flight plans are removed from its flight plan queue.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If a flight plan is not assigned to a specific UAV the flight plan scheduler shall automatically assign it to the next available UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a flight plan is assigned to a specific UAV it shall be placed in the UAV's execution queue.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a flight route is scheduled for execution  its waypoints  takeoff altitude  and identifier shall be used to instantiate a new flight plan
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When requested by the user  a currently executing mission plan shall be cancelled by removing all pending flight plans and removing all synchronization points.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The FlightPattern for synchronized landing shall direct each UAV to synchronize at the final waypoint of the preceding route  ascend or descend to a unique altitude  synchronize  fly to the longitude and latitude of the home coordinates  synchronize  and then descend to the landing altitude.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The FlightPattern for synchronized takeoff shall direct each UAV to takeoff to a unique altitude  synchronize with other UAVs  fly at the unique altitude to the longitude and latitude of the first waypoint of the subsequent route  synchronize with other UAVs  descend or ascend to the target waypoint  and synchronize with other UAVs to complete the flight pattern.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a predefined FlightPattern is included in a MissionPlan  it shall be expanded  prior to use into a set of waypoints and synchronization points for each of the participating UAVs.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The MissionPlan shall be specified as a JSON file (see attached example).
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a UAV is executing flight plans and reaches a synchronization point  it shall wait to proceed until all other UAVs sharing the same synchronization point have also reached this point.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The flight plans of two or more UAVs shall be synchronized by inserting shared synchronization points between the ordered list of flight routes assigned to each participating UAV.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Each individual UAV that is included in a MissionPlan shall have an ordered list of one or more flight routes assigned to it.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If a UAV is in the air when a flight plan is assigned  the takeoff altitude in the flight plan is ignored.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If no takeoff altitude is prescribed in the flight plan assigned to a UAV currently on the ground  then the system-wide default altitude is used as the target takeoff altitude.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If a takeoff altitude is prescribed in the flight plan assigned to a UAV currently on the ground  then that altitude is used as the target takeoff altitude.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the takeoff command is issued  the _FlightSchedulingAndExecution _checks for a pre-specified altitude in the flight plan.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the UAV reaches a target waypoint  if additional waypoints are specified in the flight plan  then the _VehicleCore_  shall send the next waypoint to the UAV's _GCS_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If the computed distance from the UAV to the target waypoint is less than {{THRESHOLD_WAYPOINT_DISTANCE}} than the waypoint shall be considered reached.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the _VehicleCore_ receives the UAV's current coordinates and if the UAV has an assigned target waypoint  then the _VehicleCore_ shall compute the current distance to the target waypoint.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: At the start of a flight plan the system shall send the first target waypoint to the UAV's _GCS_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the hover in place command is rescinded the UAV's state is reverted to its previous state.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: If the UAV is in 'hover in place' mode then no waypoints directives for that UAV shall be sent to the _GCS_.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: "When the UAV is commanded to hover in place  its state is changed to ""hover in place"" and a command is sent to the GCS."
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the UAV is commanded to return to home  the current flight plan shall be removed and a new flight plan shall be created containing only a single waypoint representing its original launch coordinates.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Direction between two coordinates shall be specified using a velocity vector from the first coordinate.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Distances computed between two coordinates shall be accurate within 1 meter over a distance of 400 000 meters.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When requested  coordinates shall be transformed from p-vectors to the default representation.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When requested  coordinates shall be transformed from n-vectors to the default representation.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When requested  the _CoordinateSystem_ shall be transform coordinates from the default representation to p-vectors.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When requested  the _CoordinateSystem_ shall transform coordinates transformed from the default representation to n-vectors.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The default coordinate representation shall use LLA (longitude  latitude  altitude) format.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: The flight route xml format includes an optional takeoff altitude tag
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When the _UIMiddleware_ requests a flight route identified by its unique name  the _FlighRouteManager _shall retrieve the associated file.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a flight route is uploaded to Dronology  the _FlightRouteManager_ shall  save it under a unique name as an xml file.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Upon receipt of a new or modified flight route from the UI middleware  the _FlightRouteManager_ shall check that it is a {{VALID_FLIGHT_ROUTE}}  i.e.  that all waypoints are valid coordinates and that the flight route contains at least one waypoint.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Flight routes shall be specified in the standard XML_FlightRoute format.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a mode change message to {USER_CONTROLLED}} is received the Vehicle shall transition to  {USER_CONTROLLED}}.
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: When a UAV is executing flight plans and reaches a synchronization point  which is followed by a delay task  it shall wait to proceed until the delay specified in seconds is expired
label: Design Definition

STR.REQ: Configuration parameters  including map coordinates  scale  map style  and color scheme shall be stored in a JSON Object on the server

In the edit mode  users can create new waypoints  move waypoints  remove waypoints  etc. When the edit mode is not activated  disable these editing functionalities.    Clicking the ""Save"" button will send the current waypoints data to dronology and exit the edit mode. Clicking the ""Cancel"" button will undo all changes (fetch the data from dronology again) and exit the edit mode.  "

Clicking on ""Follow Selected UAVs"" will automatically zoom and pan the map so that all selected UAVs (or rather the rectangle that bounds all selected UAVs) are always centered in the map and constitutes for about 60% of the view.    Clicking on ""View All UAVs"" will zoom and pan the map so that all UAVs and their planned routes (or rather the rectangle that bounds all UAVs and their planned routes) are centered in the map and constitutes for about 60% of the view."

STR.REQ: "To see if the haversine distance is an acceptable method for computing distance  it should be compared to travel distance and laser distance.    travel distance is the distance a drone would actually have to travel to get there (accounting for the shape of the Earth and assuming that changes in altitude would be gradual).    laser distance is the distance a laser beam would travel assuming line of sight. So it would compute this distance even when a laser would need to travel through the Earth. For example  if point A was at the North Pole and point B was at the South Pole  the laser distance would tell you the distance straight through the Earth."
label: Sub-task

STR.REQ: "Replace existing Coordinate implementation with new LlaCoordinate    This requires:  * updating the flight simulator to work with double values instead of long  * UI adaptations to display coordinates correctly  * additional functionality to modify waypoints (LlaCoordinate is now immutable)"
label: Sub-task

STR.REQ: This function should take two wgs-84 position one for the current position and another for the target position and the number of meters to travel. it should return a new wgs-84 position that is the specified distance away.
label: Sub-task

STR.REQ: Latitude needs to be calculated using atan2. See equation 6 in http://www.navlab.net/Publications/A_Nonsingular_Horizontal_Position_Representation.pdf
label: Sub-task

STR.REQ: "Everyone should get to work with the position class that they are most comfortable with. And to enable everyone to get the most out of the position classes  distance functions should be provided to all classes. That is what motivates this abstract base class.    The class should have these methods:    laser Distance (that takes another WGS-84 position) -> returns a double  travel distance(that takes another WGS-84 position) -> returns a double  toNvector() -> returns an NVector  toPVector() -> returns a PVector  toLlaCoordinate() -> returns an LlaCoordinate  toRotMatrix() -> returns a matrix that can take displacement vectors from ECEF and rotate them into NED vectors"
label: Sub-task

STR.REQ: "NvecInterpolator does position reckoning in WGS-84 and a replacement simulator that uses it needs to be created     * Do movement simulator and battery simulator   * Replicate all base functionality of simple simulator "
label: Sub-task

STR.REQ: "An N-vector is a normal Vector that points out from the surface of the WGS-84 reference ellipsoid. The normal vector is combined with an altitude which represents the distance above (or below) the reference ellipsoid (note this is the distance above sea level as sea level is defined as the surface of the ellipsoid in WGS-84).    The n-vector and altitude together precisely define a position on Earth. The n-vector should be a unit vector (i.e. a vector with a magnitude = 1). The altitude should be in meters.    Why we need this:  In dead reckoning calculations we need to take a position and add a velocity vector to it. Drones often stay at constant elevations as they travel around the Earth. This is a problem when using p-vectors and velocity vectors. The instantaneous velocity is tangent to the reference ellipsoid and thus follows the curvature of the Earth. In aviation it is common to use n-vectors because there is a nice formula that addresses this exact problem. This also makes programming easier when considering edge cases like a drone flying east near the meridian where longitude = 180 degrees. Using latitude and longitude for this calculation requires special logic to handle the transition to longitude = -179.9999... degrees but no special logic is required when using n-vectors. N-vectors also handle gracefully the poles where longitude is undefined. For more information about n-vectors see [this article|http://www.navlab.net/Publications/A_Nonsingular_Horizontal_Position_Representation.pdf]      The following instance fields are needed in the nvector class:  * x - the x component of the n-vector  * y - the y component of the n-vector  * z - the z component of the n-vector  * altitude - the distance above sea level in meters    The following methods are needed in the n-vector class:  * toLla - takes no arguments and maps the n-vector and altitude to a latitude  longitude and altitude.  * toPvec - takes no arguments and maps the n-vector and altitude to an X  Y  and Z coordinate in the WGS-84 reference frame.  "
label: Sub-task

STR.REQ: "We need an immutable class holding three doubles for latitude  longitude  and altitude (LLA).  This class should have the following data members:  * latitude - the angle north of the equator in degrees (negative angles define latitudes in the southern hemisphere)   * longitude - the angle east of the prime meridian in degrees (negative angles define longitudes in the western hemisphere)   * altitude - the distance above sea level or more precisely the distance above the surface of the WGS-84 reference ellipsoid. For this project we need this distance in meters (though traditionally  in aviation this distance is measured in feet so be careful when using this class)    This class should have the following methods  * toPvec - takes no arguments and maps LLA to an X  Y  and Z coordinate in the WGS-84 reference frame.  * toNvec - takes no arguments and maps LLA to a coordinate defined by an N-vector plus altitude. An N-vector is a normal vector on the surface of the WGS-84 reference ellipsoid. This ellipsoid defines the position of sea level everywhere on Earth. By pairing this with an altitude  we can precisely define a position. N-vectors have nice properties that make dead reckoning easier and more accurate (Dead reckoning is the process of calculating a drones current position by using a previously determined position  and advancing that position based upon known or estimated speeds over elapsed time and course. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_reckoning for more info). To learn more about the nice properties that n-vectors have  see this article http://www.navlab.net/Publications/A_Nonsingular_Horizontal_Position_Representation.pdf from The Journal of Navigation.     Perhaps Coordinate.java may be modified into the LlaCoordinate class we need."
label: Sub-task

STR.REQ: "We need an immutable class holding three doubles for X  Y  and Z in the WGS-84 reference frame.    Here is some background information about the WGS-84 reference frame:    * The origin of this frame is at the center of mass of the Earth  * The X-axis points towards where the equator meets the prime meridean (latitude 0  longitude 0)  * The Z-axis points towards the geographic north pole (latitude 90  longitude undefined)  * The Y-axis can be derived using right hand rule and points towards latitude 0  longitude 90    This class should have the following instance fields:  * x - the position along the X-axis in meters  * y - the position along the Y-axis in meters  * z - the position along the Z-axis in meters    This class should have the following methods:  * toLla - takes no arguments and returns the latitude  longitude  and altitude for this position  * toNvec - takes no arguments and returns the n-vector plus altitude for this position"
label: Sub-task

The current parameters include: project_name  map_center_lan  map_center_lon  and map_default_zoom.    In the future  we will use this class for configurable parameters."
